content.question: Andrew Jackson vetoed the recharter of the Bank of the United States partly because he believed that the bank

choices.label: concentrated too much power in the hands of a few people
gave too many loans to assist unstable state and local banks
was secretly funding the abolitionist movement
was overly subsidized by state tax monies
planned to create new paper money unsupported by gold or silver

content.answer: concentrated too much power in the hands of a few people

skill.text: Skill 1.B: Explain a historical concept, development, or process.
